trans-unit.source: .NET web app in Azure App Service with New Relic application performance management
trans-unit.target: .NET web app in Azure App Service with New Relic application performance management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use New Relic's performance monitoring for ASP.NET applications running on Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use New Relic's performance monitoring for ASP.NET applications running on Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: .NET web app in Azure App Service with New Relic application performance management
trans-unit.target: .NET web app in Azure App Service with New Relic application performance management

trans-unit.source: This guide describes how to add New Relic's world-class performance
trans-unit.target: This guide describes how to add New Relic's world-class performance

trans-unit.source: monitoring to your web app in <link><linkText>Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: monitoring to your web app in <link><linkText>Azure App Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: We'll cover the fast and simple
trans-unit.target: We'll cover the fast and simple

trans-unit.source: process to add New Relic to your application and introduce you to some of
trans-unit.target: process to add New Relic to your application and introduce you to some of

trans-unit.source: New Relic's features.
trans-unit.target: New Relic's features.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using New Relic, see <link><linkText>Using New Relic</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using New Relic, see <link><linkText>Using New Relic</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: What is New Relic?
trans-unit.target: What is New Relic?

trans-unit.source: New Relic is a developer focused tool that monitors your production applications
trans-unit.target: New Relic is a developer focused tool that monitors your production applications

trans-unit.source: and provides deep insight into their performance and reliability.
trans-unit.target: and provides deep insight into their performance and reliability.

trans-unit.source: It is
trans-unit.target: It is

trans-unit.source: designed to save you time when identifying and diagnosing performance issues, and
trans-unit.target: designed to save you time when identifying and diagnosing performance issues, and

trans-unit.source: it puts the information you need to solve these issues at your fingertips.
trans-unit.target: it puts the information you need to solve these issues at your fingertips.

trans-unit.source: New Relic tracks the load time and throughput for your web transaction, both from
trans-unit.target: New Relic tracks the load time and throughput for your web transaction, both from

trans-unit.source: the server and your users' browsers.
trans-unit.target: the server and your users' browsers.

trans-unit.source: It shows how much time you spend in the
trans-unit.target: It shows how much time you spend in the

trans-unit.source: database, analyzes slow queries and web requests, provides uptime monitoring and
trans-unit.target: database, analyzes slow queries and web requests, provides uptime monitoring and

trans-unit.source: alerting, tracks application exceptions, and a whole lot more.
trans-unit.target: alerting, tracks application exceptions, and a whole lot more.

trans-unit.source: New Relic special pricing through the Azure Store
trans-unit.target: New Relic special pricing through the Azure Store

trans-unit.source: New Relic Standard is free to Azure users.
trans-unit.target: New Relic Standard is free to Azure users.

trans-unit.source: New Relic Pro is offered in multiple packages based on which website mode you are using, and the instance size if you are using reserved mode.
trans-unit.target: New Relic Pro is offered in multiple packages based on which website mode you are using, and the instance size if you are using reserved mode.

trans-unit.source: For pricing information see the <link><linkText>New Relic page in the Azure Marketplace</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For pricing information see the <link><linkText>New Relic page in the Azure Marketplace</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Pricing is only listed for up to 10 compute instances.
trans-unit.target: Pricing is only listed for up to 10 compute instances.

trans-unit.source: For counts greater than 10 please contact New Relic (sales@newrelic.com) for volume pricing.
trans-unit.target: For counts greater than 10 please contact New Relic (sales@newrelic.com) for volume pricing.

trans-unit.source: Azure customers receive a 2 week trial subscription of New Relic Pro when they deploy the New Relic agent.
trans-unit.target: Azure customers receive a 2 week trial subscription of New Relic Pro when they deploy the New Relic agent.

trans-unit.source: Sign up for New Relic using the Azure Marketplace
trans-unit.target: Sign up for New Relic using the Azure Marketplace

trans-unit.source: New Relic integrates seamlessly with Azure Web Roles, Worker roles and Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: New Relic integrates seamlessly with Azure Web Roles, Worker roles and Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: To sign up for New Relic directly from the Azure Marketplace, follow these four easy steps.
trans-unit.target: To sign up for New Relic directly from the Azure Marketplace, follow these four easy steps.

trans-unit.source: Step 1. Create a New Relic account
trans-unit.target: Step 1. Create a New Relic account

trans-unit.source: Log in to the Azure preview portal and click New in the corner.
trans-unit.target: Log in to the Azure preview portal and click New in the corner.

trans-unit.source: Click Developer services > New Relic APM.
trans-unit.target: Click Developer services > New Relic APM.

trans-unit.source: Configure your New Relic account by specifying the following, then click Create.
trans-unit.target: Configure your New Relic account by specifying the following, then click Create.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Pricing Tier
trans-unit.target: Pricing Tier

trans-unit.source: Resource Group
trans-unit.target: Resource Group

trans-unit.source: Subscription
trans-unit.target: Subscription

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: Legal Terms
trans-unit.target: Legal Terms

trans-unit.source: After you click Create, your New Relic account will begin the creation process.
trans-unit.target: After you click Create, your New Relic account will begin the creation process.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the status by clicking the Notifications button.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the status by clicking the Notifications button.

trans-unit.source: Once it is created, the New Relic account's blade will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: Once it is created, the New Relic account's blade will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: To retrieve your New Relic license key, look at the Essentials panel at the top of the blade.
trans-unit.target: To retrieve your New Relic license key, look at the Essentials panel at the top of the blade.

trans-unit.source: Your Web Apps instance will automatically register this license key in its app settings when you integrate your web app with the New Relic account.
trans-unit.target: Your Web Apps instance will automatically register this license key in its app settings when you integrate your web app with the New Relic account.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Configure New Relic integration for your web app
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Configure New Relic integration for your web app

trans-unit.source: Open your web app's blade in the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Open your web app's blade in the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click the "..." menu at the top of the blade and select Add tiles.
trans-unit.target: Click the "..." menu at the top of the blade and select Add tiles.

trans-unit.source: On the Monitoring tab select Application summary and drag it to where you want the tile to appear on your web app's blade.
trans-unit.target: On the Monitoring tab select Application summary and drag it to where you want the tile to appear on your web app's blade.

trans-unit.source: Click Done to finish adding tiles.
trans-unit.target: Click Done to finish adding tiles.

trans-unit.source: Click the Application monitoring tile and select New Relic.
trans-unit.target: Click the Application monitoring tile and select New Relic.

trans-unit.source: Select the account that you created in the previous step, then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select the account that you created in the previous step, then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Once the save operation has completed, click All Settings in the web app's blade, then click Application settings.
trans-unit.target: Once the save operation has completed, click All Settings in the web app's blade, then click Application settings.

trans-unit.source: You should see the NEWRELIC\_LICENSEKEY setting added to the App settings section of the blade to support New Relic:
trans-unit.target: You should see the NEWRELIC\_LICENSEKEY setting added to the App settings section of the blade to support New Relic:

trans-unit.source: It may take up to 30 seconds for the new app setting to take effect.
trans-unit.target: It may take up to 30 seconds for the new app setting to take effect.

trans-unit.source: To force the settings to take effect immediately, restart the web app.
trans-unit.target: To force the settings to take effect immediately, restart the web app.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Publish the ASP.NET web app
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Publish the ASP.NET web app

trans-unit.source: Using Visual Studio, publish your web app.
trans-unit.target: Using Visual Studio, publish your web app.

trans-unit.source: If you have previously published your web app, publish it again so that the Web Apps instance would add the required New Relic NuGet package to enable New Relic monitoring.
trans-unit.target: If you have previously published your web app, publish it again so that the Web Apps instance would add the required New Relic NuGet package to enable New Relic monitoring.

trans-unit.source: Step 4. Check out your application's performance in New Relic.
trans-unit.target: Step 4. Check out your application's performance in New Relic.

trans-unit.source: To view your New Relic dashboard:
trans-unit.target: To view your New Relic dashboard:

trans-unit.source: Open your web app's blade in the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Open your web app's blade in the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Application monitoring > application name > View at New Relic.
trans-unit.target: Click Application monitoring > application name > View at New Relic.

trans-unit.source: If this is the first time you use your account, configure your account information.
trans-unit.target: If this is the first time you use your account, configure your account information.

trans-unit.source: From the New Relic menu bar, select Applications > (application's name).
trans-unit.target: From the New Relic menu bar, select Applications > (application's name).

trans-unit.source: The Monitoring > Overview dashboard automatically appears.
trans-unit.target: The Monitoring > Overview dashboard automatically appears.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Relic monitoring dashboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Relic monitoring dashboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After you select an app from the list on your Applications menu, the Overview dashboard shows current app server and browser information.
trans-unit.target: After you select an app from the list on your Applications menu, the Overview dashboard shows current app server and browser information.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Using New Relic
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Using New Relic

trans-unit.source: After you select your app from the list on the Applications menu, the Overview dashboard shows current app server and browser information.
trans-unit.target: After you select your app from the list on the Applications menu, the Overview dashboard shows current app server and browser information.

trans-unit.source: To toggle between the two views, click the App server or Browser button.
trans-unit.target: To toggle between the two views, click the App server or Browser button.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the <html></html>standard New Relic UI<html></html> and <html></html>dashboard drill-down<html></html> functions, the Applications Overview dashboard has additional functions.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the <html></html>standard New Relic UI<html></html> and <html></html>dashboard drill-down<html></html> functions, the Applications Overview dashboard has additional functions.

trans-unit.target: Web Transactions

trans-unit.target: dashboard

trans-unit.source: Click the Web Transactions table on the Applications Overview dashboard. Or, to view details about a specific web transaction (including
trans-unit.target: Click the Web Transactions table on the Applications Overview dashboard. Or, to view details about a specific web transaction (including

trans-unit.source: dashboard
trans-unit.target: dashboard

trans-unit.source: Click the Error rate chart's title on the Applications Overview dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Click the Error rate chart's title on the Applications Overview dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Tip:
trans-unit.target: Tip:

trans-unit.target: You can also view the Errors dashboard from

trans-unit.target: > (your app) > Events > Errors.

trans-unit.source: View the app's server details
trans-unit.target: View the app's server details

trans-unit.source: Do any of the following:
trans-unit.target: Do any of the following:

trans-unit.source: Toggle between a table view of the hosts or breakout metric details of each host.
trans-unit.target: Toggle between a table view of the hosts or breakout metric details of each host.

trans-unit.source: Click an individual server's name.
trans-unit.target: Click an individual server's name.

trans-unit.source: Point to an individual server's Apdex score.
trans-unit.target: Point to an individual server's Apdex score.

trans-unit.source: Click an individual server's CPU usage or Memory.
trans-unit.target: Click an individual server's CPU usage or Memory.

trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <link><linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title></link>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
